result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy C Anderson

records.addlTxt:
10:33 AM Defendant Troy C Anderson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
2022TR001194, 2022TR001195 tracking with 22CF110:
Court questions the defendant regarding an Attorney.  Defendant is not able to pay for the retainer yet, he needs a couple more weeks.  Court advises other ways of getting an Attorney.  

BY THE COURT:  Court will reset one more time so he can get Atty Van Wagner.
bond continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:09 AM Defendant Troy C Anderson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
2022TR001194, 2022TR001195 tracking with 22CF110:
Court questions the defendant regarding counsel.  Defendant has not had enough time to speak to an Attorney but has a meeting tomorrow with Atty Van Wagner.

BY THE COURT:  Reset one more time.
bond continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:16 PM Defendant Troy C Anderson appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received the complaint. Court confirms address and phone. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. Defendant plans on hiring an attorney.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause for Riverside purposes.
Atty Burdon requests $1,000.00 signature bond with no special conditions.  BY THE COURT:  Court sets $1,000.00 signature bond with no special conditions.
Set for IA
Initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
